Issue.creator: denyeart
Issue.summary: CouchDB timeout causes error upon retry
Issue.description: If a state db document update to CouchDB has a http timeout (currently defaulted at 35s), the transaction may eventually succeed in CouchDB, but the peer will do a retry using the previous CouchDB document revision number. The retry will therefore fail due to revision number conflict. The peer will think it failed, when in fact it succeeded. Peer panics when it can't process the block to completion, since subsequent blocks should not be processed. Need to fix retry logic to account for this scenario, potentially by introducing a higher level retry that could get the new revision number for a final attempt.
